name: Mealybugs
appearance: Small (1/20 to 1/5 inch), oval-shaped insects covered in white, waxy coating
associatedPlants: Peace Lily, Dieffenbachia, Monstera, Orchid, Burro's Tail
symptoms:
• Stunted growth
• Yellow or wilted leaves
• Deformed growth
• Loss of flower buds
• Defoliation
• Chlorosis
manage:
1. Prune affected areas
2. Use insecticidal soap
3. Apply neem oil
4. Introduce natural predators
5. Use systemic insecticides

name: Spider Mites
appearance: Tiny (0.4 mm), oval-shaped arachnids, varying in color from red and brown to yellow and green
symptoms:
• Stippling on leaves
• Yellowing or bronzing of foliage
• Webbing on plants
• Leaf drop
manage:
1. Increase humidity
2. Use insecticidal soap
3. Apply horticultural oils
4. Introduce predatory mites
5. Use miticides

name: Scale Insects
appearance: Small (1/16 to 1/8 inch), immobile insects with waxy or armored coverings, varying in color from brown to white
associatedPlants: Peace Lily, Dieffenbachia, Monstera, Orchid, Burro's Tail
symptoms:
• Yellowing leaves
• Branch dieback
• Sooty mold growth
• Reduced plant vigor
manage:
1. Prune infested areas
2. Use horticultural oils
3. Apply insecticidal soap
4. Introduce natural predators
5. Use systemic insecticides

name: Fungus Gnats
appearance: Small (about 1/8 inch), dark-bodied flies with long legs and antennae
symptoms:
• Wilting
• Yellowing leaves
• Poor growth
• Root damage
manage:
1. Reduce watering
2. Use sticky traps
3. Apply biological controls
4. Use insecticidal soil drenches
5. Improve soil drainage

name: Aphids
appearance: Small (1/16 to 1/8 inch), pear-shaped insects, varying in color from green and yellow to black and red
associatedPlants: Peace Lily, Dieffenbachia, Orchid, Burro's Tail
symptoms:
• Curled or distorted leaves
• Stunted growth
• Honeydew secretion
• Sooty mold growth
manage:
1. Use strong water spray
2. Apply insecticidal soap
3. Use neem oil
4. Introduce natural predators
5. Apply systemic insecticides

name: Thrips
appearance: Tiny (1/25 to 1/8 inch), slender insects with fringed wings, varying in color from pale yellow to dark brown
symptoms:
• Silvery or bronze patches on leaves
• Distorted growth
• Scarring on fruits
• Flower deformation
manage:
1. Use sticky traps
2. Apply insecticidal soap
3. Use neem oil
4. Introduce predatory mites
5. Apply spinosad-based products
